text: Lorne Munroe (November 24, 1924 â€“ May 4, 2020) was an Canadian-American cellist.Gibson, Ronald and Winters, Kenneth, "Munroe, Lorne* , Encyclopedia of Music in Canada. Accessed 12 March 2009 He was principal cellist of the Philadelphia Orchestra from 1951 to 1964 and principal cellist of the New York Philharmonic from 1964 to 1996. He retired in 1996.Broznan, Nadine, "Chronicle", New York Times, January 22, 1996. Accessed 12 March 2009 Munroe was born in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Munroe died on May 4, 2020 at the age of 95.NY and Philly Lament Principal Cellist ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:American cellists Category:Musicians from Winnipeg Category:20th- century musicians
title: Lorne Munroe
